column4: Anyone ? No networking of any sort on U10.04 Studio on a  Dell 1525
pastebin: sudo lshw -C network
plug the wire and type: sudo mii-tool
ifconfig -a
does it show any interfaces? eth0 or so
sudo ifconfig eth0 up && killall dhclient && sudo dhclient eth0
ok just: sudo dhclient eth0
the last line is what matters, wait for it
check the cable and do this again: sudo mii-tool
seems there was something wrong with your cable, try again: sudo dhclient eth0 .. if it didn't work then the issue is with your route r
ping google.com
it was a cable problem then
sudo ifconfig wlan0 up && iwlist scan
and check if wlan  is blocked in: rfkill list
in sudo lshw -C network.. does wlan0 exist? and is it unclaimed or is there a driver?
try flipping the wireless kill switch on your laptop
what ubuntu version are you running? and paste the card line from: lspci
sudo apt-get install bcmwl-kernel-source
and reboot
in system > administration > hardware drivers  .. turn it on
in Software Sources, make sure that all sources are checked
open it from a terminal and check if there are any errors
